description: From French pensif (“thoughtful”), from penser (“to think”) (from Latin pēnsō) + -if (English -ive).

adjectives.description: pensive (comparative more pensive, superlative most pensive)

entries.meaning: Having the appearance of deep, often melancholic, thinking.

examples: Abstruse thought and profound researches I prohibit, and will severely punish, by the pensive melancholy which they introduce
